pages.text: This chapter goes over general information like units and prefixes, and the default recipe balancing.

Units are used extensively throughout QMD and modded minecraft in general. Your probably familiar with some like $(l)millibuckets$(): mB or $(l)Redstone flux$(): RF. Nuclearcraft adds more units like $(l)heat$(): H or $(l)Rads per tick$(): Rad/t and so does QMD.$(br2)An important thing to know is units can have prefixes. We have already one $(l)milli$() : m in millibuckets. Prefixes are the symbol that comes before the unit that tells you how to scale the unit.

QMD, Nuclearcraft and many other mods use a system of prefixes called SI prefixes. They are used extensively in science and engineering around the world. Each SI prefix is a certain power of 10. $(br)For example milli is 10^-3 = 0.001, this is a thousandth, so there is 10^3 = 1000 mB 'millibuckets' in a B 'bucket'.$(br2)Here is a list of all the SI Prefixes.

$(li)yotta: Y = 10^24$(li)zetta: Z = 10^21$(li)exa: E = 10^18$(li)peta: P = 10^15$(li)tera: T = 10^12$(li)giga: G = 10^9$(li)mega: M = 10^6$(li)kilo: k = 10^3$(li)milli: m = 10^-3$(li)micro: Î¼ or u = 10^-6$(li)nano: n = 10^-9$(li)pico: p = 10^-12$(li)femto: f = 10^-15$(li)atto: a = 10^-18$(li)zepto: z = 10^-21 $(li)yocto: y = 10^-24

There a few units introduced into QMD you may not know: $(li)pu: particle units. This is an amount of particles by default each 'mole' item or bucket of fluid is 1 Mpu = 1000000 pu$(br)This unit was made up for QMD, it is $(l)not a real unit$()$(li)eV: electron volt. This is the amount of energy a individual particle has. Since particles are very small this is a very small amount of energy (1.602x10^-19 joules if your wondering).

$(li)eV/c^2: electron volt per c squared. This is a mass of a particle, this is very small since particles are very small (1.783x10^-36 kilograms if your wondering)$(li)T: Tesla. The strength of a magnetic field$(li)K: Kelvin. A unit of temperature. 0 K is -273.15 Celsius or -459.67 Fahrenheit.
